title: Children from poorer backgrounds ‘must not be deprived of life rich in reading’
description: War Horse writer Sir Michael Morpurgo has, along with all the children’s laureates of the past 25 years, written to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer to demand sustained funding towards books and reading for the under-sevens ...

title: Sunak faces crunch vote as Rwanda plan dealt fresh blow by senior resignations
description: The fate of Rishi Sunak’s Rwanda Bill is in the balance as a crunch vote looms after two Tory deputy chairmen resigned to join the biggest Conservative rebellion of his leadership. The Prime Minister is battling to see off another major revolt on ...

title: Rishi Sunak faces a 24-hour battle to save his premiership after SIXTY Tories revolt over his Rwanda Bill and threaten to kill the flagship policy altogether in Commons vote ...
description: Rishi Sunak suffered a 60-strong rebellion in a series of brutal Commons votes - and warned that the flagship policy could be killed off altogether unless he caves in.

title: Sunak faces crunch vote as Rwanda plan dealt fresh blow by senior resignations
description: The Prime Minister is battling to see off another major revolt on Wednesday as MPs decide whether to back the legislation.

title: UK PM Sunak's authority faces test in showdown over Rwanda asylum plan
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak faces a major parliamentary showdown on Wednesday over his plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda, with many of his own lawmakers threatening to rebel after they lost an initial bid to toughen his proposed law.

title: What Lee Anderson and Brendan Clarke-Smith’s resignations mean for Sunak
description: Rishi Sunak appointed Lee Anderson as a visible — and vocal — sign that he wanted to reach out to red wall voters. The prime minister is now hoping that his deputy party chairman’s resignation is not seen as an equally unmissable indication that his ...

title: Sunak told ignoring European judges on Rwanda would break the law
description: The minister Rishi Sunak tasked with ignoring interim injunctions from European judges previously warned that doing so would breach international law. The prime minister appointed Michael Tomlinson as the minister for illegal migration, making him ...
